content: Does FHIR provide the ability to express "units" for non-numeric types (i.e., not integer, decimal, or quantity)? I think the answer is "no" (and I think I would like it to remain "no") but the reason I am asking is that LOINC code 21112-8 is "Birth date", but has an "example unit" of "{mm/dd/yyyy}".
I suppose it is kind of like a unit, in that it provides interpretation for the entered value. But, I think field hints serve that purpose in this case.
Yes. Also, we'd strongly discourage entering date as a string, which means there's no need to specify the format of the shared data
